support_icon_clicked.description: User clicked the support icon on the header of the Adblock popup

built_cdp_payload.description: A payload has been built with the intention of sending it to CDP. This is debug information, and will temporarily include the eventStats until the CDP server is ready to ingest them.

eventStats.description: Counts of behavior event logs since the last payload.

uncompressedPayloadSize.description: Size in bytes of the uncompressed and unencrypted payload.

bt_loader_blocked.description: BTLoader was blocked, possibly indicating a non-partner extension is present

data.description: Data about why BTLoader was blocked

aaListsStatus.description: The status of the Acceptable Ads lists. 0: none, 1: AA, 2: AA Privacy, 3: both

errorMsg.description: Browser string indicating the error that occurred

data.description: Data about the BTLoader success event

aaListsStatus.description: The status of the Acceptable Ads lists. 0: none, 1: AA, 2: AA Privacy, 3: both

data.description: Data about why Acceptable Ads bait 1 was blocked

aaListsStatus.description: The status of the Acceptable Ads lists. 0: none, 1: AA, 2: AA Privacy, 3: both

errorMsg.description: Browser string indicating the error that occurred

aa_bait1_success.description: Acceptable Ads bait 1 was successfully loaded

data.description: Data about the Acceptable Ads bait 1 success event

aaListsStatus.description: The status of the Acceptable Ads lists. 0: none, 1: AA, 2: AA Privacy, 3: both

data.description: Data about why Acceptable Ads bait 2 was blocked

aaListsStatus.description: The status of the Acceptable Ads lists. 0: none, 1: AA, 2: AA Privacy, 3: both

errorMsg.description: Browser string indicating the error that occurred

aa_bait2_success.description: Acceptable Ads bait 2 was successfully loaded

data.description: Data about the Acceptable Ads bait 2 success event

aaListsStatus.description: The status of the Acceptable Ads lists. 0: none, 1: AA, 2: AA Privacy, 3: both

aa_other_blocked.description: Acceptable Ads filters on Amazon, Yahoo, LinkedIn, Outlook were blocked

data.description: Data about why Acceptable Ads filters were blocked

aaListsStatus.description: The status of the Acceptable Ads lists. 0: none, 1: AA, 2: AA Privacy, 3: both

errorMsg.description: Browser string indicating the error that occurred

aa_other_success.description: Acceptable Ads filters on Amazon, Yahoo, LinkedIn, Outlook were successfully loaded

data.description: Data about the Acceptable Ads filters success event

aaListsStatus.description: The status of the Acceptable Ads lists. 0: none, 1: AA, 2: AA Privacy, 3: both

facts_snapshot.description: Cohorts facts snapshot used for cohort estimation

countryCode.description: The 2-letter country code of the user

installType.description: The installation type of the extension

hasPremium.description: Whether the user has a premium subscription

installDate.description: The timestamp when the extension was installed

recreated_dnr_rules.description: On extension upgrade, our DNR filter management module will compare the dynamic DNR rules that the browser has with the filters that we know about. If these do not match, we recreate the DNR rules and log this report.

data.description: Report on the before and after state of the recreation

recreateStats.description: Stats on how many DNR rules were recreated

recreatedRulesCount.description: How many DNR rules were recreated

removedRulesCount.description: How many existing DNR rules were removed

checkResultBefore.description: Results of the data integrity check done before recreating the DNR rules.

valid.description: True if the data integrity check passed. We only do the recreation if it failed, so this would be expected to always be false.

extraRulesInDNRCount.description: Count of the number of active dynamic DNR rules which we do not expect to see

missingRulesInDNRCount.description: Count of the number of rules that our filters expected to exist but didn't

checkResultAfter.description: Results of the data integrity check done after recreating the DNR rules.

valid.description: True if the data integrity check passed. We expect this to be true after the rule recreation has run.

extraRulesInDNRCount.description: Count of the number of active dynamic DNR rules which we do not expect to see. We expect this to be 0 after the rule recreation has run.

missingRulesInDNRCount.description: Count of the number of rules that our filters expected to exist but didn't. We expect this to be 0 after the rule recreation has run.

exceeded_static_rule_count_limit.description: Debug log when someone runs into the 'set of enabled rulesets exceeds the rule count limit' error when enabling static rulesets

data.description: Data on the current state of static rules and the rulesets being enabled or disabled. Rule counts refer to static DNR rules, bundled in the extension at build time in rulesets.

enableRulesetIds.description: Ruleset IDs that were to be enabled

enableRuleCount.description: Static rules that we are trying to enable

disableRulesetIds.description: Ruleset IDs that were to be disabled

disableRuleCount.description: Static rules that we are trying to disable

currentEnabledRulesetIdsBefore.description: Currently enabled ruleset IDs, gathered before calling updateEnabledRulesets

currentEnabledRulesetIdsAfter.description: Currently enabled ruleset IDs, gathered after calling updateEnabledRulesets

currentEnabledRuleCountBefore.description: Used static rules, gathered before calling updateEnabledRulesets

currentEnabledRuleCountAfter.description: Used static rules, gathered after calling updateEnabledRulesets

availableRuleCountBefore.description: Available static rules, gathered before calling updateEnabledRulesets

availableRuleCountAfter.description: Available static rules, gathered after calling updateEnabledRulesets

command_received.description: Extension received a valid IPM command from the remote config

initialization_complete.description: The extension has finished initializing without any errors

subscriptionsCount.description: The number of subscriptions the user has active

availableStaticRuleCount.description: The number of DNR static rules that the user has available, or null for MV2 extensions

marks.description: Specific points in time when something happened

startTime.description: Milliseconds elapsed since the service worker started

measures.description: Measurements of how long steps took

startTime.description: When the measure started, in milliseconds elapsed since the service worker started

duration.description: Duration that the step took in milliseconds

initialization_error.description: Errors recorded during the initialization of the extension

errorMsg.description: The error message that was recorded

hasInternalError.description: Whether or not the error string matched 'internal error' which indicates that it is a browser error

marks.description: Specific points in time when something happened

startTime.description: Milliseconds elapsed since the service worker started

measures.description: Measurements of how long steps took

startTime.description: When the measure started, in milliseconds elapsed since the service worker started

duration.description: Duration that the step took in milliseconds

zero_subs_reset.description: Event logged when subscriptions are reset to defaults due to zero enabled subscriptions

data.description: Debug metadata about the subscription reset

subs.description: The total number of subscriptions after reset

enabledSubs.description: The number of enabled subscriptions after reset

enabledRulesets.description: The number of enabled DNR rulesets after reset

totalUserFilters.description: The total number of user filters after reset

dynamicRules.description: The number of dynamic DNR rules after reset

dataCorrupted.description: Whether the data is corrupted. True if the extension has detected that storage has thrown an error.

firstRun.description: Whether this is the first run of the extension based on the number of subscriptions and user filters.

reinitialized.description: Whether the extension was reinitialized before reset.

errorMsg.description: An error that occurred when readding subscriptions, if any

lastErrorMsg.description: The last error in the browser runtime, if any

command_ready.description: 'create_tab' IPM command has passed all checks and new tab is going to be created at the next possible opportunity

tab_created.description: A tab has been created for the IPM command

tab_loaded.description: The contents of the tab for the IPM command have been loaded

command_ready.description: 'create_on_page_dialog' IPM command has passed all checks and on-page dialog is going to be created at the next possible opportunity

dialog_button_clicked.description: The user clicked on the button presented on the dialog

dialog_closed.description: The user closed the dialog by clicking the close icon in the dialog header

dialog_ignored.description: The user did not interact with the dialog while being injected into the page, and the dialog no longer can be interacted with

dialog_injected.description: The extension injected the dialog into the page and rendered it. This doesnâ€™t mean that the dialog is visible to the user, or that it looks as expected

test_event.description: TEST: A logging test event for various types of data

test_event_no_data.description: TEST: A logging test event that has no associated data

test_got_experiment_flag.description: TEST: In the content test script, an experiment was loaded

flagName.description: The flag name that was loaded

test_message_received.description: TEST: A logger test event indicating the UI page received a request to log

data.description: The data sent to the test listener

test_event.description: TEST: A logging test event for various types of data

test_event_no_data.description: TEST: A logging test event that has no associated data
